Class: TwoFA

TwoFA(baseUrl, version, contentType)

Class for 2-Factor Authentication

Constructor

new TwoFA(baseUrl, version, contentType)

Instantiate class
Parameters:
Name Type Default Description
baseUrl string https://api.infobip.com Infobip personal base URL.
version number 2 API version. The version is overridable on an individual method call level - useful if some methods are still using old version numbers.
contentType string json The type of data the API returns. Values: "json" or "xml".
Source:
  • service/TwoFA.js, line 24
Example
// Instantiate class
let twoFA = new infobip.TwoFA()

Methods

authorize(auth)

Authorize API calls
Parameters:
Name Type Description
auth Auth Instance of authorization class
Source:
  • service/TwoFA.js, line 42

(async) getApp(applicationId, version) → {Object}

Get a 2FA application by its applicationId
Parameters:
Name Type Default Description
applicationId string Unique ID of the app.
version number 1 The API version to use. If set to "", will use the instance version.
Source:
  • service/TwoFA.js, line 87
Throws:
Error
Returns:
Type
Object
Example
console.log(await twoFA.getApp('797493BB352B7B84588F108CEBAAE43E '))

(async) newApp(params, version) → {Object}

Create an application
Parameters:
Name Type Default Description
params Object The app properties.
version number 1 The API version to use. If set to "", will use the instance version.
Source:
  • service/TwoFA.js, line 133
Throws:
Error
Returns:
Type
Object
Example
console.log(await twoFA.newApp({
 "name": "Mobile Number Verifier",
 "configuration": {
     "pinAttempts": 10,
     "allowMultiplePinVerifications": true,
     "pinTimeToLive": "15m",
     "verifyPinLimit": "1/3s",
     "sendPinPerApplicationLimit": "10000/1d",
     "sendPinPerPhoneNumberLimit": "3/1d"
 },
 "enabled": true
}))

(async) newMessageTemplate(applicationId, params, version) → {Object}

Create a message template
Parameters:
Name Type Default Description
applicationId string Unique ID of the app.
params Object The template properties.
version Object 1 The API version to use. If set to "", uses the instance version.
Source:
  • service/TwoFA.js, line 243
Throws:
Error
Returns:
Type
Object
Example
console.log(await twoFA.newMessageTemplate('E39FA9F9983246FEEE938A70FE0C94BD', {
    "pinType": "NUMERIC",
    "pinPlaceholder": "<pin>",
    "messageText": "<pin> is your Verification Code",
    "pinLength": 6,
    "senderId": "Infobip",
    "language": "en",
    "repeatDTMF": "1#",
    "speechRate": 1
}))

 "from": "InfoSMS",
 "to": "41793026727"
}))
